skill.name: bruno-api
skill.description: Generate comprehensive API endpoint documentation from Bruno (.bru) files by mapping requests to a Django4Lyfe/Diversio-style backend implementation (Django REST Framework or Django Ninja), including auth/permissions, multi-tenant filtering, request/response schemas, and line-numbered code references. Use for single endpoints, directory scans of .bru files, or when writing docs to a specific output path.

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation generation instructions. No executable code, network calls, or file system modifications beyond standard read operations. The skill uses only safe read-only analysis tools (Read, Glob, Grep) with optional Bash for file discovery.

content.user_title: Generate API docs from Bruno files
content.value_statement: Manually tracing API endpoints from Bruno test files to Django implementations is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automatically maps .bru files to their Django REST Framework or Ninja counterparts, generating complete documentation with request schemas, authentication details, and line-numbered code references.
actual_capabilities: Parse Bruno (.bru) files to extract HTTP method, URL, headers, parameters, and request body
Locate Django REST Framework or Ninja endpoint implementations in the codebase
Generate markdown documentation with request/response schemas and examples
Document authentication, permissions, and multi-tenant filtering rules
Include line-numbered code references for frontend and testing integration
Support single file analysis and recursive directory scanning
limitations: Designed for Django REST Framework and Django Ninja backends only
Requires access to the source codebase for implementation lookup
Does not execute tests or validate API responses
Cannot generate documentation for non-Django backends

use_cases.title: Document existing APIs
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive documentation for Django API endpoints by analyzing Bruno test files and mapping them to implementation code.

use_cases.title: Create integration guides
use_cases.description: Produce TypeScript types, React Query hooks, and request/response examples for seamless frontend integration.

use_cases.title: Generate test documentation
use_cases.description: Extract Bruno test assertions and edge cases into structured documentation for testing workflows.

prompt_templates.title: Single endpoint docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate API documentation for the Bruno file at /path/to/endpoint.bru. Include implementation details with line numbers, request/response schemas, and frontend integration examples.

prompt_templates.title: Scan directory
prompt_templates.scenario: Document all endpoints in a folder
prompt_templates.prompt: Scan the /api/tests directory for all .bru files and generate documentation for each. Use --scan to find all files and --output docs/api_reference.md to write the combined documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Dry run plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a dry-run analysis on /path/to/api_tests.bru. Show me the endpoint summary, where you will search for the implementation, and what documentation sections will be generated.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-tenant audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate documentation for the /api/v2/users.bru endpoint. Focus on multi-tenant filtering, company/org scoping rules, and authentication requirements.

output_examples.input: Generate documentation for the /api/v2/users.bru file with --output docs/users_endpoint.md
output: - 200: User object with id, email, name, company_id

best_practices: Provide the full path to .bru files for accurate parsing
Use --dry-run first when documenting unfamiliar endpoints
Include --output flag to save generated documentation to version-controlled files
Review generated line-numbered references against current codebase
anti_patterns: Using the skill without access to the Django source codebase
Skipping the --dry-run step when exploring new API territories
Expecting documentation for non-Django frameworks like Flask or FastAPI
Relying solely on generated docs without verifying against running API

faq.question: What Bruno file formats are supported?
faq.answer: Standard .bru files with HTTP method, URL, headers, params, body, and optional test assertions.

faq.question: Does this skill execute the Bruno tests?
faq.answer: No, it only reads and parses .bru files for documentation. Use Bruno CLI separately to run tests.

faq.question: Can I use this with Flask or FastAPI backends?
faq.answer: The skill is optimized for Django REST Framework and Django Ninja. Other frameworks require custom adaptation.

faq.question: How does this skill handle authentication?
faq.answer: It detects JWT tokens, session cookies, and explicit no-auth signals from Bruno files and documents them.

faq.question: Why are some line numbers marked as [BLOCKING]?
faq.answer: When the endpoint implementation cannot be located in the codebase, the skill marks references as BLOCKING.

faq.question: How is this different from Swagger/OpenAPI tools?
faq.answer: This skill generates human-readable documentation with business logic context, not just API specifications.
